title: Multimodal AI Capabilities (Vision & Image Analysis)
description:
Enable Consoul to analyze images using vision-capable LLM providers (Claude 3.5, GPT-4V, Gemini), allowing users to ask questions about screenshots, diagrams, UI mockups, code screenshots, and other visual content.

## Vision
Transform Consoul into a multimodal AI assistant that can understand both text and images, enabling richer interactions for debugging, design review, documentation, and code understanding.

## Scope
1. Core image analysis tool with security validation
2. Provider-specific multimodal message formatting
3. TUI integration for image references and display
4. Configuration system for image analysis settings
5. Permission and approval workflows
6. Documentation and examples

## Success Criteria
- Users can analyze images with natural language queries
- Works seamlessly across Claude, OpenAI, Google providers
- Images validated for security (path traversal, file types, size limits)
- Clear permission/approval workflow for privacy
- Rich TUI integration with image previews (where supported)
- Comprehensive documentation and usage examples

## Target Providers
- Anthropic Claude 3+ (Opus, Sonnet, Haiku, 3.5 Sonnet)
- OpenAI GPT-4V (gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini, gpt-4-vision-preview)
- Google Gemini (gemini-2.0-flash, gemini-1.5-pro, gemini-pro-vision)
- Ollama local vision models (llava, bakllava)

## Use Cases
- Code screenshot analysis ("What's wrong with this error?")
- UI/UX design review ("Is this interface accessible?")
- Diagram explanation ("Explain this architecture diagram")
- Debug assistance ("Why is my terminal showing this?")
- Documentation generation ("Generate alt text for this image")

## Technical Foundation
- LangChain multimodal message support
- Base64 image encoding
- Provider-specific content block formatting
- File validation and security controls
- Permission system integration

## Dependencies
- EPIC-002 (Core AI & Configuration System) - Completed
- EPIC-004 (Tool Calling System) - Completed
